title: Public transport for the A League Round 21 – Melbourne Victory v Central Coast Mariners: Sunday 19 March 2023
articleContent:
Public transport for the A League Round 21 – Melbourne Victory v Central Coast Mariners: Sunday 19 March 2023

Isuzu UTE A League Men’s is back at AAMI Park. Public transport is your best way to enjoy it, as the Melbourne Victory taking on Central Coast Mariners. Extra services will help you get to and from the AAMI Park on Sunday 19 March 2023.

The event will begin at 5pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey Planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

 Metropolitan train

Return service from Richmond Station

  • Camberwell – leaving at 7:16pm from Platform 9
  • Glen Waverley – leaving at 7:23pm from Platform 10
  • Pakenham – leaving at 7:28pm from Platform 6

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Route 70

  • Trams will operate from Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

 Metropolitan bus

Passengers can catch the following buses close to AAMI Park:

  • Route 246

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the match.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

 Regional train

  • Normal services departing from Southern Cross Station

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.
articleDescription: Public transport for the A League Round 21 – Melbourne Victory v Central Coast Mariners: Sunday 19 March 2023
